concept.title: Access Manager
concept.abstract: The Access Manager uses the Spark Toolkit, a custom application hosted on Heroku to modify object permissions, Apex Class and VisualForce page access, and run field level security.

conbody.p: Click on Access Manager in the Spark Admin tab of the Spark Framework app to launch the Spark Toolkit.

ul.li: All packages are selected by default. Otherwise, uncheck the related checkbox to limit updating profiles only for specific packages.

For standard and custom object access, check the Standard and Custom checkboxes to update object and field access on any object that is not part of the managed packages.
Account, Contact, and User objects are included by default.
If there is a namespace assigned to the customer environment, enter the Package Namespace.

Select the applicable org Profiles and click Fetch Profiles.
Selection of All Profiles is disabled, so staff users must select profiles on an individual basis.
If the process exceeds 10 minutes, select fewer profiles.

For each profile selected in the previous tab, there are 3 sections to configure:
Object Permissions - Disabled by default
Class and Page Access
Field Access

Staff users will need to configure Object Permissions only if the org is brand new, when any new objects are added to a package, or if they need to modify an existing configuration.
When Object Permissions is enabled, View All and Modify All are disabled by default and best practices recommend restricting access to System Administrators only.
Click Update Profiles to complete the profile set up.
All profiles are updated as indicated by the blue Profile tiles.
In the event a profile failed to update, an orange Profile tile will display instead.
